intro: Piptocalyx dichotomus, commonly known as the dichotomous piper, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Piperaceae, which includes many species of flowering plants known for their aromatic properties. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that are typically clustered in spikes. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and undergrowth. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
